intro: Azalea jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine azalea, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its delicate blooms. Azalea jasminiflora thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
